channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Avicenna: a challenge dataset for natural language generation toward commonsense syllogistic reasoning
item.description: The Avicenna corpus was developed as a benchmark for syllogistic NLG.

item.title: ProgNet: A Transferable Deep Network for Aircraft Engine Damage Propagation Prognosis under Real Flight Conditions
item.description: Then, ProgNet is transferred to the target domain of obtained degradation features for fine-tuning.

item.title: Multilingual News Location Detection using an Entity-Based Siamese Network with Semi-Supervised Contrastive Learning and Knowledge Base
item.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of our approach, and due to the lack of datasets in this area, we also contribute to the research community with a gold-standard multilingual news-location dataset, NewsLOC.

item.title: SHLE: Devices Tracking and Depth Filtering for Stereo-based Height Limit Estimation
item.description: In stage 1, a novel devices detection and tracking scheme is introduced, which accurately locate the height limit devices in the left or right image.

item.title: Ultra-High-Definition Low-Light Image Enhancement: A Benchmark and Transformer-Based Method
item.description: In this paper, we consider the task of low-light image enhancement (LLIE) and introduce a large-scale database consisting of images at 4K and 8K resolution.

item.title: Generative Colorization of Structured Mobile Web Pages
item.description: The web page colorization problem is then formalized as a task of estimating plausible color styles for a given web page content with a given hierarchical structure of the elements.

item.title: Variational Reasoning over Incomplete Knowledge Graphs for Conversational Recommendation
item.description: We propose a variational Bayesian method to approximate posterior distributions over dialogue-specific subgraphs, which not only leverages the dialogue corpus for restructuring missing entity relations but also dynamically selects knowledge based on the dialogue context.

item.title: TransPath: Learning Heuristics For Grid-Based Pathfinding via Transformers
item.description: To this end, we suggest learning the instance-dependent heuristic proxies that are supposed to notably increase the efficiency of the search.

item.title: Automatically Annotating Indoor Images with CAD Models via RGB-D Scans
item.description: We present an automatic method for annotating images of indoor scenes with the CAD models of the objects by relying on RGB-D scans.

item.title: Jamdani Motif Generation using Conditional GAN
item.description: Our experimental results of the pix2pix model on this dataset show satisfactory outputs of computer-generated images of Jamdani motifs and we believe that our work will open a new avenue for further research.

item.title: Confidence-Aware Paced-Curriculum Learning by Label Smoothing for Surgical Scene Understanding
item.description: In this work, we design a paced curriculum by label smoothing (P-CBLS) using paced learning with uniform label smoothing (ULS) for classification tasks and fuse uniform and spatially varying label smoothing (SVLS) for semantic segmentation tasks in a curriculum manner.

item.title: Renormalization in the neural network-quantum field theory correspondence
item.description: A statistical ensemble of neural networks can be described in terms of a quantum field theory (NN-QFT correspondence).

item.title: Certified Policy Smoothing for Cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The experimental results show that our method produces meaningful guaranteed robustness for all models and environments.

item.title: Few-shot human motion prediction for heterogeneous sensors
item.description: Human motion prediction is a complex task as it involves forecasting variables over time on a graph of connected sensors.

item.title: Multi-queue Momentum Contrast for Microvideo-Product Retrieval
item.description: The booming development and huge market of micro-videos bring new e-commerce channels for merchants.

item.title: Mind Your Heart: Stealthy Backdoor Attack on Dynamic Deep Neural Network in Edge Computing
item.description: Transforming off-the-shelf deep neural network (DNN) models into dynamic multi-exit architectures can achieve inference and transmission efficiency by fragmenting and distributing a large DNN model in edge computing scenarios (e. g., edge devices and cloud servers).

item.title: Predictive Coding Based Multiscale Network with Encoder-Decoder LSTM for Video Prediction
item.description: As a predictive coding model, it is updated by a combination of bottom-up and top-down information flows, which is different from traditional bottom-up training style.

item.title: Robust Meta-Representation Learning via Global Label Inference and Classification
item.description: Empirically, MeLa outperforms existing methods across a diverse range of benchmarks, in particular under a more challenging setting where the number of training tasks is limited and labels are task-specific.

item.title: Crowd Score: A Method for the Evaluation of Jokes using Large Language Model AI Voters as Judges
item.description: We tested our methodology on 52 jokes in a crowd of four AI voters with different humour types: affiliative, self-enhancing, aggressive and self-defeating.

item.title: Mining User-aware Multi-Relations for Fake News Detection in Large Scale Online Social Networks
item.description: In this paper, we construct a dual-layer graph (i. e., the news layer and the user layer) to extract multiple relations of news and users in social networks to derive rich information for detecting fake news.

item.title: Towards dynamic stability analysis of sustainable power grids using graph neural networks
item.description: To mitigate climate change, the share of renewable needs to be increased.

item.title: Improving Narrative Relationship Embeddings by Training with Additional Inverse-Relationship Constraints
item.description: We consider the problem of embedding character-entity relationships from the reduced semantic space of narratives, proposing and evaluating the assumption that these relationships hold under a reflection operation.

item.title: Class Prototype-based Cleaner for Label Noise Learning
item.description: Semi-supervised learning based methods are current SOTA solutions to the noisy-label learning problem, which rely on learning an unsupervised label cleaner first to divide the training samples into a labeled set for clean data and an unlabeled set for noise data.

item.title: An Audio-Visual Speech Separation Model Inspired by Cortico-Thalamo-Cortical Circuits
item.description: Then, inspired by the large number of connections between cortical regions and the thalamus, the model fuses the auditory and visual information in a thalamic subnetwork through top-down connections.

item.title: 3D Highlighter: Localizing Regions on 3D Shapes via Text Descriptions
item.description: A key feature of our system is the ability to interpret "out-of-domain" localizations.

item.title: SLGTformer: An Attention-Based Approach to Sign Language Recognition
item.description: However, this frontal appearance can be quantified as a temporal sequence of human body pose, leading to Sign Language Recognition through the learning of spatiotemporal dynamics of skeleton keypoints.

item.title: TMS-Net: A Segmentation Network Coupled With A Run-time Quality Control Method For Robust Cardiac Image Segmentation
item.description: Different from previous multi-view networks, TMS-Net has a single encoder and three decoders, leading to better noise robustness, segmentation performance and run-time quality estimation in our experiments on the segmentation of the left atrium on STACOM 2013 and STACOM 2018 challenge datasets.

item.title: From Images to Textual Prompts: Zero-shot VQA with Frozen Large Language Models
item.description: To address this issue, we propose \emph{Img2Prompt}, a plug-and-play module that provides the prompts that can bridge the aforementioned modality and task disconnections, so that LLMs can perform zero-shot VQA tasks without end-to-end training.

item.title: Beyond Contrastive Learning: A Variational Generative Model for Multilingual Retrieval
item.description: Contrastive learning has been successfully used for retrieval of semantically aligned sentences, but it often requires large batch sizes or careful engineering to work well.

item.title: Generating music with sentiment using Transformer-GANs
item.description: The field of Automatic Music Generation has seen significant progress thanks to the advent of Deep Learning.

item.title: Automatic Semantic Modeling for Structural Data Source with the Prior Knowledge from Knowledge Base
item.description: Therefore, an automatic approach for learning the semantics of a data source is desirable.

item.title: Hidden Poison: Machine Unlearning Enables Camouflaged Poisoning Attacks
item.description: We introduce camouflaged data poisoning attacks, a new attack vector that arises in the context of machine unlearning and other settings when model retraining may be induced.

item.title: Exploring Content Relationships for Distilling Efficient GANs
item.description: This paper proposes a content relationship distillation (CRD) to tackle the over-parameterized generative adversarial networks (GANs) for the serviceability in cutting-edge devices.

item.title: A Survey of Mix-based Data Augmentation: Taxonomy, Methods, Applications, and Explainability
item.description: Owing to its generalization, MixDA has penetrated a variety of applications which are also completely reviewed in this work.

item.title: Neighboring state-based RL Exploration
item.description: Reinforcement Learning is a powerful tool to model decision-making processes.

item.title: Revisiting Residual Networks for Adversarial Robustness: An Architectural Perspective
item.description: In contrast, little attention was devoted to analyzing the role of architectural elements (such as topology, depth, and width) on adversarial robustness.

item.title: Hyperparameters in Contextual RL are Highly Situational
item.description: Although Reinforcement Learning (RL) has shown impressive results in games and simulation, real-world application of RL suffers from its instability under changing environment conditions and hyperparameters.

item.title: Generalized Decoding for Pixel, Image, and Language
item.description: We present X-Decoder, a generalized decoding model that can predict pixel-level segmentation and language tokens seamlessly.

item.title: Deep Unfolded Tensor Robust PCA with Self-supervised Learning
item.description: Tensor robust principal component analysis (RPCA), which seeks to separate a low-rank tensor from its sparse corruptions, has been crucial in data science and machine learning where tensor structures are becoming more prevalent.

item.title: Uncontrolled Lexical Exposure Leads to Overestimation of Compositional Generalization in Pretrained Models
item.description: Human linguistic capacity is often characterized by compositionality and the generalization it enables -- human learners can produce and comprehend novel complex expressions by composing known parts.

item.title: Analyzing Semantic Faithfulness of Language Models via Input Intervention on Conversational Question Answering
item.description: While transformer models achieve high performance on standard question answering tasks, we show that they fail to be semantically faithful once we perform these interventions for a significant number of cases (~50% for deletion intervention, and ~20% drop in accuracy for negation intervention).

item.title: AgAsk: An Agent to Help Answer Farmer's Questions From Scientific Documents
item.description: On the basis of these needs we release an information retrieval test collection comprising real questions, a large collection of scientific documents split in passages, and ground truth relevance assessments indicating which passages are relevant to each question.

item.title: Training language models for deeper understanding improves brain alignment
item.description: We show that training language models for deeper narrative understanding results in richer representations that have improved alignment to human brain activity.

item.title: Entropy- and Distance-Based Predictors From GPT-2 Attention Patterns Predict Reading Times Over and Above GPT-2 Surprisal
item.description: Transformer-based large language models are trained to make predictions about the next word by aggregating representations of previous tokens through their self-attention mechanism.

item.title: Cross-Linguistic Syntactic Difference in Multilingual BERT: How Good is It and How Does It Affect Transfer?
item.description: We demonstrate that the distance between the distributions of different languages is highly consistent with the syntactic difference in terms of linguistic formalisms.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Learning of Monocular Depth Estimation via Consistency Regularization with K-way Disjoint Masking
item.description: Semi-Supervised Learning (SSL) has recently accomplished successful achievements in various fields such as image classification, object detection, and semantic segmentation, which typically require a lot of labour to construct ground-truth.

item.title: Automatic Emotion Modelling in Written Stories
item.description: Telling stories is an integral part of human communication which can evoke emotions and influence the affective states of the audience.

item.title: Control of Continuous Quantum Systems with Many Degrees of Freedom based on Convergent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Although there have been a few successful applications of deep RL to quantum control problems, most of the existing RL algorithms suffer from instabilities and unsatisfactory reproducibility, and require a large amount of fine-tuning and a large computational budget, both of which limit their applicability.

item.title: When and Why Test Generators for Deep Learning Produce Invalid Inputs: an Empirical Study
item.description: In this paper, we investigate to what extent TIGs can generate valid inputs, according to both automated and human validators.

item.title: Is it worth it? An experimental comparison of six deep- and classical machine learning methods for unsupervised anomaly detection in time series
item.description: The detection of anomalies in time series data is crucial in a wide range of applications, such as system monitoring, health care or cyber security.
